Get to know the history of the wildest park in Sofia.

Loven Park in Sofia is one of the largest and most popular parks in the city.It is located in the southern part of Sofia and offers a unique combination of natural beauty, diverse plant species, and attractive landmarks.The history of Loven Park in Sofia begins in 1878 when Bulgaria regained its independence after the Liberation from Ottoman rule. The park was established on the site of a former Ottoman garden and transformed into a public park with the idea of becoming a place for relaxation and entertainment for the citizens of Sofia.In 1882, the park was officially opened and named "Loven Park" as various trees and shrubs from local and foreign flora were planted, and aviaries with wild animals were installed. At that time, the park provided opportunities for walks, picnics, and sports games, becoming a favorite place for leisure among urban dwellers.

Over the years, Loven Park in Sofia has undergone various changes and renovations. New paths and alleys have been constructed, and new attractions have been added. One of the most famous landmarks in the park is the Hunting Area, which features a large lake and a climbing wall, attracting enthusiasts of mountaineering and rock climbing.Loven Park is also home to several monuments and sculptures that reflect the history and culture of Sofia. Some of them include the monument of Hristo Botev, the monument of Vasil Levski, and the monument of the Resistance and Liberation of Sofia during World War II.Today, Loven Park remains a popular destination for walks, sports activities, picnics, and outdoor relaxation. The park offers a wide range of recreational opportunities and entertainment while preserving its natural and historical beauty.
Learn what species the Hunting Park is home to.

Loven Park in Sofia is characterized by a rich and diverse flora and fauna. It is home to many species of trees, shrubs, flowers, and fungi, creating a unique natural environment.Among the trees found in the park are oaks, beeches, hornbeams, pines, cedars, spruces, and more. They form a dense and shady forest, providing a refreshing atmosphere during hot summer days.The flora of Loven Park also includes a variety of flowers and shrubs, enhancing the color palette of the park during spring and summer. Visitors can find roses, rhododendrons, azaleas, tulips, narcissus, flowering shrubs, and many others.When it comes to fauna, numerous bird species can be observed in Loven Park, such as wagtails, rooks, ravens and small birds. The park is also home to various rodents, including squirrels, hedgehogs, and rabbits, which are often seen in the grassy areas.

The lake in Loven Park is home to different fish species, including carp, perch, and trout, making it a popular spot for fishing.Observing the flora and fauna in Loven Park is a popular activity among visitors, particularly nature lovers and photographers who can enjoy beautiful views and capture unique moments in the park.
How to take care of the park? Your guide to conservation.

The SCHWARZ IT Bulgaria team cleaned the Hunting Park in Sofia during a large-scale action organized on May 14, 2022. The initiative is part of the company\'s strategy for sustainable green practices and environmental protection. All employees of Schwarz IT participated in the action with the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãcleaning the park of waste and dried trees, so that it becomes a favorite place for the people of Sofia to walk again. The company, which is one of the fastest growing IT sectors, has set itself the ambitious goal of improving the Hunting Park and returning it to its former glory.

The Schwarz IT team believes that the example will be contagious and that there will be followers with whom to join forces against environmental pollution. The initiative to renew the Hunting Park initially started with cleaning, but the company also has other ideas for future improvement of the environment. The area, which is among the emblematic places of Sofia, was until recently submerged in waste. Now, after the cleaning campaign, most of the pollutants have been removed and visitors can enjoy more pleasant walks in nature.
